item.title: rendering resource in react
item.description:
In order to not forget about rendering all states of resource provisioning and handle errors gracefully I introduced react HoC(higher order component) with such props and it’s working great:

type ResourceDisplay = {|
  whenError: Element<*>,
  whenLoading: Element<*>,
  whenReady: Element<*>,
  whenEmpty: Element<*>,
  isLoading: boolean,
  isError: boolean,
  resource: Array<*>,
|}`

item.title: redux batched subscribe
item.description: When you have too many dispatches when usign redux performance of rendering might slow down. There’s in quite nice store enhancer - https://github.com/tappleby/redux-batched-subscribe that allows to easy debounce notify to improve perf.

item.title: react-komposer
item.description: Recently I found quite nice HoC abstracting async data delivery for component. It’s called https://github.com/arunoda/react-komposer and I recommend you check it out as it provides clean API for defining async depencencies.
